message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with the inference of Autonomous Systems (ASes) interconnections and their commercial Type-of-Relationships (ToR) to provide a better topological view of the Internet. This falls under the category of network science and network infrastructure, which is covered by cs.NI. The paper also discusses the use of algorithms and heuristics to solve the ToR inference problem, which is related to computer security and cryptography (cs.CR). The proposed algorithm uses a dense sub-graph of top-level ASes, which involves data analysis and graph theory (cs.DS). The paper also evaluates the algorithm using AS-level paths collected from RouteViews BGP paths and DIMES traceroute measurements, which involves data mining and information retrieval (cs.SI). Finally, the paper discusses the robustness of the algorithm to errors in the core, which is related to information theory (cs.IT).
